lore: Hounds typically live in packs and develop elaborate strategies that never fail to catch prey.\n\nA drop of blood is enough for the Blood Hound to track its prey, no matter the distance or the species it is following. When it finds its quarry, it does not pounce on it without thinking, instead waiting for its pack to arrive and assessing the situation before developing a strategy.
menagerieDialog: (It yawns and stretches into a downward dog position.)
Hiss... hiss!\n(You do know you're not a cat, right?)
(It's running around in small circles, wiggling its ass for no reason. Yep, it's a hound all right.)
(It smells of dog sweat. You should tell Nortah to give it a bath before you leave.)
(It often scratches itself with one of its hind legs. Nortah should really check it for fleas.)
name: Blood Hound
